short_discription: Master's student in Computer Science at HAW Hamburg with practical software development experience and an interest in cutting-edge technology
about_section_1: Hi, I'm Kilian. I study computer science at HAW Hamburg. I know a lot about programming languages like C, Rust, Java, Kotlin, Dart, Python, JavaScript, HTML and CSS.
about_section_2: I have experience in front-end and back-end development using frameworks and tools such as React, Next.js, Svelte, Tailwind CSS, Flutter and Spring Boot. I am also familiar with several SQL databases.
about_section_3: I recently worked at itestra GmbH as a student software developer, contributing to a large-scale insurance project. My responsibilities included migrating legacy C code to Java, building UIs with React, and developing backend services using Spring Boot. I was also involved in designing database schemas, writing unit and integration tests, and working with CI/CD pipelines. I am currently specialising in machine learning and robotics at university.
about_section_4: Outside of work and university, I enjoy working on personal projects, such as running my own home server and configuring Nixos, as well as working on several projects. The projects I have finished are available on my GitHub. When I’m not coding, you’ll probably find me at concerts, playing football or enjoying winter sports.
bachelor_thesis_despriction: Developed and tested zero-/few-shot approaches using Llama 3.3 to automatically extract software requirements from documentation, achieving promising results that can support traditional requirements analysis
student_software_developer_description: Migrated legacy C code to Java, built user interfaces with React and Next.js, developed backend services with Spring Boot, and helped design database schemas while ensuring quality through testing and CI/CD, agile software development, UI/UX consulting and design, customer communication
